intro: Hieracium divisum subsp. hypopitys, commonly known as the lesser spearthistle, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to Europe and parts of western Asia. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads and serrated leaves. The plant typically grows in disturbed soils, such as roadsides and wastelands, and can reach heights of up to 60 cm. Its leaves are deeply lobed and often have a distinctive hairy texture, while its flowers are yellow and arranged in a flat-topped inflorescence. It is considered a minor weed but has ecological value as a food source for certain insects.
